text.section: It is State policy to coordinate all the resources available from federal, State and local governments, business, labor, and community based organizations to foster and promote a balanced, equitable, and cost-effective employment and training system. To effectuate this policy there shall be consultation between the Governor and the General Assembly in implementing the federal Workforce Investment Act and this subtitle.

It is the State's goal to assist its citizens in obtaining gainful employment and in reducing dependence on public assistance and unemployment insurance programs by:
preparing unskilled youth and adults who are economically disadvantaged for entry into the work force;
retraining those who have lost jobs or who must upgrade or replace their work skills or both; and
providing training and related services, including supportive services for low-income individuals, to increase the employability of those who encounter barriers to employment.
